metadata.title: CVE-2017-8924 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
The edge_bulk_in_callback function in drivers/usb/serial/io_ti.c in theLinux kernel before 4.10.4 allows local users to obtain sensitiveinformation (in the dmesg ringbuffer and syslog) from uninitialized kernelmemory by using a crafted USB device (posing as an io_ti USB serial device)to trigger an integer underflow.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-8924` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.13.0-16-generic - 4.13.0-16.19
linux-image-4.13.0-16-generic-lpae - 4.13.0-16.19
linux-image-4.13.0-16-lowlatency - 4.13.0-16.19
linux-image-extra-4.13.0-16-generic - 4.13.0-16.19
No subscription required

linux-image-4.13.0-1005-raspi2 - 4.13.0-1005.5
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1001-aws - 4.15.0-1001.1
No subscription required

No subscription required
